<h3 id="X34471">X(34471)&nbsp;=&nbsp; MIDPOINT OF X(1) AND X(3612)</h3>
Barycentrics &nbsp;&nbsp; a*(-a+b+c)*(3*a^2+(b+c)*a-2*(b-c)^2) : :
<br>
Trilinears &nbsp;&nbsp; 3 cos A + 2 cos B + 2 cos C - 1 : :
<b><br>
X(34471) = 2*X(1)+X(5217)
</b>
<p>
See Kadir Altintas and César Lozada, <a href="http://www.hyacinthos.epizy.com/message.php?msg=29622"> <b>Hyacinthos 29622</b></a>.
</p>
<p>
X(34471) lies on these lines: {1, 3}, {2, 10950}, {4, 15950}, {6, 17440}, {8, 4999}, {11, 2476}, {12, 944}, {21, 2320}, {33, 4214}, {37, 2261}, {45, 22356}, {78, 3711}, {80, 1656}, {140, 10573}, {145, {13463, 20075}, {13607, 31397}, {13901, 19066}, {13902, 19030}, {13958, 19065}, {13959, 19029}, {15015, 17636}, {15228, 15696}, {17044, 26101}, {17662, 31480}, {18526, 31479}, {21031, 27383}, {21677, 30478}, {22238, 33655}, {23846, 28348}, {24558, 26105}, {28922, 30847}, {28924, 30826}, {30124, 32954}, {31165, 31424}
</p>
<p>
X(34471) = midpoint of X(1) and X(3612) <br>
X(34471) = reflection of X(i) in X(j) for these (i,j): (5217, 3612), (10895, 11375) <br>
X(34471) = X(3612)-of-anti-Aquila triangle <br>
X(34471) = X(5217)-of-Mandart-incircle triangle <br>
X(34471) = X(7547)-of-2nd circumperp triangle <br>
X(34471) = {X(i),X(j)}-harmonic conjugate of X(k) for these (i,j,k): (55, 3304, 10966), (65, 3576, 5204), (999, 7742, 56), (3057, 17609, 18839), (3338, 5126, 56), (3340, 7987, 1155), (3576, 16193, 56), (5010, 11009, 12702), (8071, 16203, 56), (10267, 22766, 5172), (16193, 31786, 65) <br>
</p>
<hr class="gray">
